Mass. reports 213 new confirmed coronavirus cases, 4 new deathsKey metrics monitored for the state’s pace of reopening are still low relative to the springtime surge, but Monday’s numbers come as Massachusetts entered the second week of freezing its reopening plan after a recent uptick in COVID-19 cases.

Massachusetts may join effort to prevent US Postal Service cutsMassachusetts’s top prosecutor is discussing a lawsuit with other state attorneys general to prevent the Trump administration from potentially further curtailing US Postal Service operations amid an expected rush of voting by mail in this fall’s general election.

Trump says Biden would ‘destroy’ the suburbs. What is he talking about?Along with trying to appeal to a key slice of the electorate that he’s currently losing, President Donald Trump does have a specific policy issue in mind, one rooted in the debate about housing, zoning, and local control that for decades has played out in places such as the suburbs of Greater Boston.

In pandemic recovery, New York has had more success than Mass. What explains the gap?While both New York and Massachusetts have charted remarkable roads to recovery, it is New York — the state with the highest total death count in the country — that has emerged as a national leader this summer.

Massachusetts may join effort to prevent US Postal Service cutsMassachusetts’s top prosecutor is discussing a lawsuit with other state attorneys general to prevent the Trump administration from potentially further curtailing US Postal Service operations amid an expected rush of voting by mail in this fall’s general election.

Trump says Biden would ‘destroy’ the suburbs. What is he talking about?Along with trying to appeal to a key slice of the electorate that he’s currently losing, President Donald Trump does have a specific policy issue in mind, one rooted in the debate about housing, zoning, and local control that for decades has played out in places such as the suburbs of Greater Boston.

In pandemic recovery, New York has had more success than Mass. What explains the gap?While both New York and Massachusetts have charted remarkable roads to recovery, it is New York — the state with the highest total death count in the country — that has emerged as a national leader this summer.

What is he talking about?Along with trying to appeal to a key slice of the electorate that he’s currently losing, President Donald Trump does have a specific policy issue in mind, one rooted in the debate about housing, zoning, and local control that for decades has played out in places such as the suburbs of Greater Boston.

‘Why should we trust you?’ Black Americans, hardest hit by COVID-19, are the most skeptical of potential vaccinesBlack Americans’ distrust of the health care industry stems from a long history of medical exploitation and misconduct.
